snippet: A sofa on which Abraham Lincoln is thought to have sat while wooing Mary Todd has been refurbished for a parlor at an 1830s house in Springfield, Ill.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; sofa on which Abraham Lincoln is thought to have sat has been refurbished for a parlor at an 1830s house in Springfield, Ill; works by 19th-century British dog painter John Emms are on display at William Secord Gallery and for sale at Bonhams; exhibition exploring how 19th-century books, prints and photographs presented people who might now be viewed as gay opens at Library Company of Philadelphia.
lead_paragraph: A sofa on which Abraham Lincoln is thought to have sat while wooing Mary Todd has been refurbished for a parlor at an 1830s house in Springfield, Ill.

headline.main: Where Lincoln Sat, Transfixed by Todd
headline.print_headline: Where Lincoln Sat, Transfixed by Todd
